job_tasks.phrase: deal with big data which needs to be validated, processed (apply calculations) and loaded into systems for further processing
job_tasks.justification: This phrase describes the core activities of data validation, processing (including calculations), and loading data into systems, which are foundational elements of data engineering.

job_tasks.phrase: Build and maintain new ETL solutions and calculation engines
job_tasks.justification: Building and maintaining ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) solutions directly falls under data engineering, as does the creation of calculation engines for data processing.

job_tasks.phrase: Implement a new architecture to deliver data to the Credit Risk Datawarehouse applications
job_tasks.justification: Implementing architectural changes to deliver data to applications is a software development task, focusing on the integration and delivery of data systems.

job_tasks.phrase: Whatever software you develop, you own it and support it in the full lifecycle of your product
job_tasks.justification: This highlights ownership and full lifecycle support of developed software, which is a core aspect of software development.

job_tasks.phrase: Build scalable deployment pipelines, to support Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery
job_tasks.justification: Building deployment pipelines for CI/CD is a direct indicator of MLOps/DevOps practices.

job_tasks.phrase: Automate test and make it part of the design, code, build and release process
job_tasks.justification: Automating testing within the development lifecycle (design, code, build, release) is a key component of operations engineering.

job_tasks.phrase: Own your product and know how your product(s) are performing implementing the required Observability/Monitoring
job_tasks.justification: Implementing observability and monitoring for product performance is a crucial aspect of operations engineering.

job_tasks.phrase: Improve the CI/CD maturity, move to a containerized environment, prepare for the move to the public cloud etc.
job_tasks.justification: Improving CI/CD maturity, containerization, and cloud migration are all software development and operations engineering activities.

job_tasks.phrase: We are looking for engineers who can push us to the next architectural design of our credit risk program
job_tasks.justification: This phrase indicates a need to understand the existing credit risk program and contribute to its future architectural design, implying business context alignment.

job_tasks.phrase: Our vision and purpose for COO Risk and Finance is clear: To deliver best in class data, insights and advice which empower our consumers to control, explain, predict and optimise the performance of ING.
job_tasks.justification: This statement outlines the business vision and purpose of the department, indicating a need for engineers to align with these goals.

job_tasks.phrase: Improving stability, performance, and reliability of the Credit Risk applications
job_tasks.justification: Focusing on application stability, performance, and reliability is a fundamental software development responsibility.

job_tasks.phrase: your software requires to be trustworthy and you are keen to be the best in class to learn and apply security standards
job_tasks.justification: Ensuring software is trustworthy and applying security standards falls under secure software development practices.

soft_skills.phrase: push us to the next architectural design
Whatever software you develop, you own it and support it in the full lifecycle of your product.
your software requires to be trustworthy and you are keen to be the best in class to learn and apply security standards
We expect you to share and teach your knowledge to other team members as well.
Help Credit Risk to make big steps to the future.
In short, we expect you to have or help us have a vision on how to provide our services in the future.
keen to be the best in class to learn and apply security standards

classification.rationale: The role heavily emphasizes data processing, ETL, building calculation engines, and improving the reliability and performance of data applications. While it mentions architecture and CI/CD, the core focus remains on data manipulation, processing, and the underlying infrastructure for these tasks, aligning more with an ML Engineer specializing in data pipelines and productionizing data-driven solutions.
